p: It is the most rampant and rapidly growing global problem which poses huge health and socioeconomic burdens. 6 According to 2017 reports, there were 425 million diabetic adults worldwide and this number is supposed to increase to 629 million by 2045. 3 The anti-diabetic agents which are currently in use result in serious side effects such as renal failure, anemias, weight gain, cholestatic jaundice, hypoglycemia, and drug resistance, among others. This calls for a search for safe, effective and alternative anti-diabetic agents from medicinal plants. 7, 8
